法に適う: (ほうにかなう) - to conform to the rules of etiquette
法の欠缺: (ほうのけんけつ) - gap in the law
法る: (のっとる) - to conform to; to be in accordance with; to follow (rule, tradition, example, etc.)
法を守る: (ほうをまもる) - to observe the law
法を犯す: (ほうをおかす) - to violate the law
法を説く: (ほうをとく) - to preach the truth
法を越える: (のりをこえる) - to violate the laws of nature; to overstep the bounds of moderation
法人化: (ほうじんか) - incorporation; conversion to a corporation; privatization (of a previously public body)
法人所得: (ほうじんしょとく) - corporate income
法人所得税: (ほうじんしょとくぜい) - corporate income tax
法人株主: (ほうじんかぶぬし) - institutional stockholder
法人格: (ほうじんかく) - legal personality; juridical personality
法人組織にする: (ほうじんそしきにする) - to incorporate (a firm)
法令: (ほうれい) - laws and ordinances; acts (of parliament, congress, etc.)
法令を敷く: (ほうれいをしく) - to promulgate a law
法令線: (ほうれいせん) - nasolabial fold; smile lines; laugh lines
法令順守: (ほうれいじゅんしゅ) - compliance (with laws and ordinances)
法体: (ほうたい) - clerical appearance/appearance of a priest; teachings of Buddha/condition of the universe at creation/in the pure land teachings, the name of Amitabha, or prayers to Amitabha/investiture of a Buddhist priest
法例: (ほうれい) - rules concerning application of laws
法典: (ほうてん) - code of law; body of law
法制局: (ほうせいきょく) - Cabinet Legislation Bureau
法則性: (ほうそくせい) - law-like nature; regularity
法助動詞: (ほうじょどうし) - modal auxiliary verb
法務: (ほうむ) - judicial affairs; clerical duty (in a temple)
法務大臣: (ほうむだいじん) - Minister of Justice
法務委員会: (ほうむいいんかい) - Committee on Judicial Affairs
法務官: (ほうむかん) - legal officer/legal office/judge advocate (army); praetor/pretor
法務局: (ほうむきょく) - regional legal affairs bureau
法務教官: (ほうむきょうかん) - instructor at a correctional facility (esp. juvenile detention centre)
法務省: (ほうむしょう) - Ministry of Justice
法務総監: (ほうむそうかん) - judge advocate general; JAG
法務部: (ほうむぶ) - legal office; law office; legal department
法医学: (ほういがく) - forensic medicine/forensic pathology/forensics; medical jurisprudence/legal medicine
法医解剖: (ほういかいぼう) - medicolegal autopsy; forensic autopsy
法博: (ほうはく) - Doctor of Laws; LLD
法号: (ほうごう) - priest's name or posthumous Buddhist name
法名: (ほうみょう) - Buddhist name/priest's name (on entering the priesthood); posthumous Buddhist name
法哲学: (ほうてつがく) - philosophy of law
法堂: (ほうどう) - lecture hall of a temple (esp. Zen)
法外: (ほうがい) - exorbitant; outrageous; ridiculous; absurd; excessive; inordinate; extravagant; immoderate
法威: (ほうい) - influence of Buddhism; power of Buddhism
法学系大学院共通入学試験: (ほうがくけいだいがくいんきょうつうにゅうがくしけん) - American graduate law school entrance test; LSAT
法学部: (ほうがくぶ) - law department; law school
法定: (ほうてい) - legal; designated by law
法定代理人: (ほうていだいりにん) - statutory representative; legal representative
法定休日: (ほうていきゅうじつ) - legal holiday; bank holiday
法定伝染病: (ほうていでんせんびょう) - infectious disease requiring official reporting
法定利息: (ほうていりそく) - statutory interest; legal interest; interest set by law
法定平価: (ほうていへいか) - mint parity; mint par of exchange
法定年齢: (ほうていねんれい) - legal age
法定強姦: (ほうていごうかん) - statutory rape; sexual activity with a minor under the age of consent
法定得票数: (ほうていとくひょうすう) - minimum number of votes required to elect a candidate
法定準備制度: (ほうていじゅんびせいど) - legal reserve system (USA); reserve deposit requirement system
法定準備率: (ほうていじゅんびりつ) - reserve requirement ratio; legal reserve ratio; required reserve ratio
法定準備金: (ほうていじゅんびきん) - legal reserves
法定準備預金: (ほうていじゅんびよきん) - required reserves; legal required reserves
法定犯: (ほうていはん) - {law}  malum prohibitum; unlawful act by virtue of statute

法定納本: (ほうていのうほん) - legal deposit
法定資本: (ほうていしほん) - legal capital; legal stock
法家: (ほうか) - lawyer; legalism (school of Chinese philosophy)
法帖: (ほうじょう) - copybook printed from the works of old masters of calligraphy
法師蝉: (ホウシゼミ) - Meimuna opalifera (species of cicada)
法師髪: (ほうしがみ) - short-trimmed mane (of a horse)
法座: (ほうざ) - dharma seat (seat from which one gives Buddhist sermons); Buddhist religious service

法廷侮辱: (ほうていぶじょく) - contempt of court
法廷侮辱罪: (ほうていぶじょくざい) - (crime of) contempt of court
法廷画: (ほうていが) - courtroom sketch; courtroom illustration

法廷闘争: (ほうていとうそう) - carrying conflicts into the courts
